subject: Business
title: Habit Loops in Product Design
description: A 60-second lesson on Habit Loops in Product Design.

hook.text: You check your phone 96 times a day. Not because you need to. Because the habit loop is that strong.

buildup.text: Charles Duhigg's habit loop: cue, routine, reward. Products that embed into habits become indispensable.

discovery.text: Instagram's cue: boredom. Routine: open app and scroll. Reward: variable social validation.

twist.text: Nir Eyal's Hooked model adds investment: the more you use a product, the more it knows you. Leaving gets harder.

climax.text: Toothpaste wasn't a habit until Claude Hopkins added mint flavor. The tingling became the reward that drove the loop.

punchline.text: Build the cue, design the reward, and the habit builds itself.

quiz.question: What are the three parts of Duhigg's habit loop?
